meanings.definition: Obtain (goods or a service) from an outside or foreign supplier, especially in place of an internal source.
meanings.sent1: The company outsources its customer service to a call center in another country.
meanings.sent2: Our company outsources the production of components to a factory overseas.
meanings.sent3: The small bakery outsources the baking of cakes to a magical oven in the enchanted forest.
meanings.sent4: She outsources her creativity to the muse that visits her dreams every night.
meanings.sent5: Outsourcing the task to experts ensures high-quality results.

meanings.sent1: The tech company outsources the development of software to freelance programmers.
meanings.sent2: They outsourced the design of their website to a graphic design agency.
meanings.sent3: The lazy wizard outsources his spells to a mischievous imp.
meanings.sent4: Outsourcing the project felt like sending it on a thrilling adventure.
meanings.sent5: Outsourcing the task lightened the workload for the team.
